t: The Glory of God in Zion
A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
Great*pn is*i the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised In*ld the city of our God, In*ild His holy mountain.
Beautiful*ld in elevation, The*ld joy of the whole earth, Is*ild Mount Zion on*i the sides of the north, The*ld city of the great King.
God*ld is*i in her palaces; He*ld is known as her refuge.
For*ln behold, the kings assembled, They*ld passed by together.
They*ld saw it,*i and*i so they marveled; They*ld were troubled, they hastened away.
Fear*ld took hold of them there, And*ild pain, as of a woman in birth pangs,
As*ild when*i You break the ships of Tarshish With*ld an east wind.
As*ln we have heard, So*ld we have seen In*ld the city of the Lord*s of hosts, In*ld the city of our God: God*ld will establish it forever. Selah*ipg
We*pn have thought, O God, on Your lovingkindness, In*ld the midst of Your temple.
According*ld to Your name, O God, So*ld is*i Your praise to the ends of the earth; Your*ld right hand is full of righteousness.
Let*ld Mount Zion rejoice, Let*ld the daughters of Judah be glad, Because*ld of Your judgments.
Walk*ln about Zion, And*ld go all around her. Count*ld her towers;
Mark*ld well her bulwarks; Consider*ld her palaces; That*ld you may tell it*i to the generation following.
For*ld this is*i God, Our*ld God forever and ever; He*ld will be our guide Even*ild to death.
